findings.title: Incorrect argument passed to _getPlatformOriginationFee
findings.description: The `getOriginationFees` function incorrectly uses `msg.sender` instead of the `loan_` parameter, resulting in incorrect results for users who want to know how much a loan is paying in origination fees.

findings.title: The protocol could stop working prematurely
findings.description: Alice, a pool delegate who does not know that the protocol is paused, calls `impairLoan`, thereby changing the state and making Bob’s debugging more difficult.

findings.title: Insufficient event generation
findings.description: The suggestion that a constructor emit DefaultTimelockParametersSet was rendered moot by the removal of that constructor from the contract. All other suggested events were added.

findings.title: Incorrect GovernorshipAccepted event argument
findings.description: The GovernorshipAccepted event does not have the expected arguments, causing a false alert in scripts that verify correct execution by checking emitted events.

findings.title: Partially incorrect Chainlink price feed safety checks
findings.description: Chainlink's oracle returns a negative value for an in-process liquidation, which is then unsafely cast to an uint256, causing incorrect expected amount of fund assets from the protocol and preventing liquidation.

findings.title: Incorrect implementation of EIP-4626
findings.description: The Pool implementation of EIP-4626 is incorrect for `maxDeposit` and `maxMint` because these functions do not consider all possible cases in which deposit or mint are disabled.

findings.title: setAllowedSlippage and setMinRatio functions are unreachable
findings.description: The pool administrator cannot adjust the slippage parameter of a particular collateral token due to inaccessible functions.

findings.title: Inaccurate accounting of unrealizedLosses during default warning revert
findings.description: When removing a default warning, only principal and interest are decremented from unrealizedLosses, leaving a discrepancy equal to netLateInterest_, causing users to exchange more shares than due for the same amount of assets.

findings.title: Attackers can prevent the pool manager from finishing liquidation
findings.description: The `finishCollateralLiquidation` function requires that a liquidation is no longer active. However, an attacker can prevent the liquidation from finishing by sending a collateral asset to the liquidator address.

findings.title: WithdrawalManager can have an invalid exit configuration
findings.description: The setExitConfig function sets the configuration to exit from the pool but unsafe casting allows this function to set an invalid configuration.

findings.title: Loan can be impaired when the protocol is paused
findings.description: The `impairLoan` function allows the `poolDelegate` or `governor` to impair a loan when the protocol is paused due to a missing `whenProtocolNotPaused` modifier.

findings.title: Fee treasury could go to the zero address
findings.description: If the mapleTreasury address is not set, the claim or liquidation fees are sent to the zero address until the issue is noticed.

findings.title: Attackers can prevent the pool manager from finishing liquidation
findings.description: An attacker can ensure a liquidation never completes by sending the minimal amount of the collateral token to the liquidator address.

findings.title: Inaccurate Accounting of Unrealized Losses During Default Warning Revert
findings.description: An accounting discrepancy fails to decrement `netLateInterest` from `unrealizedLosses`, which causes `unrealizedLosses` to accrue an over-inflated value.
